references: The remaining of this paper is structured as follows. SectionÂ II introduces the background of adversarial attacks against wireless systems and FL. SectionÂ III investigates the FL system model with malicious agents. The proposed VGAE-MP attack is described in SectionÂ IV. SectionÂ V discusses the performance analysis. SectionÂ VI concludes the paper. TableÂ I lists the notation used in the paper.

S5.T2.caption: TABLE II: The setting of parameters in PyTorch
S5.T2.table:
Parameters Values
number of benign devices (Iğ¼I) 5 âˆ¼similar-to\sim 30
number of attackers (Jğ½J) 1 âˆ¼similar-to\sim 5
communication rounds of the FL 100
number of local iterations (TLsubscriptğ‘‡ğ¿T_{L}) 10
model parameters in ğ’˜iâ€‹(t)subscriptğ’˜ğ‘–ğ‘¡\boldsymbol{w}_{i}(t) (Mğ‘€M) 100, 200, or 300
1st hidden layer size of the VGAE 32

regularization of the SVM loss function 0.01

references:
The benign FL is designed to improve image classification accuracy, while the proposed VGAE-MP attack aims to reduce accuracy and cause label misclassification.
The number of benign devices Iğ¼I increases from 5 to 30, while the number of attackers Jğ½J increases from 1 to 5. The global model ğ’˜Gâ€²â€‹(t)superscriptsubscriptğ’˜ğºâ€²ğ‘¡\boldsymbol{w}_{G}^{\prime}(t) in FL is trained with 100 communication rounds, and training of the local model ğ’˜iâ€‹(t)subscriptğ’˜ğ‘–ğ‘¡\boldsymbol{w}_{i}(t) is carried out in 10 iterations. For building the adjacency matrix ğ“ğ“\boldsymbol{\mathcal{A}} at the attacker, the number of selected model parameters in ğ’˜iâ€‹(t)subscriptğ’˜ğ‘–ğ‘¡\boldsymbol{w}_{i}(t), i.e., Mğ‘€M, is set to 100, 200, or 300. The VGAE encoder is a two-layer GCN network with a dropout layer to prevent overfitting. The VGAE decoder is an inner product. The Adam optimizer with a learning rate of 0.01 is adopted to optimize the network. For all datasets, we use the same encoder, decoder and SVM models. TableÂ II lists the setting of parameters in PyTorch.
